description: The government of Saint Lucia will not allow any non-national with a travel history within the last 14 days from Mainland China, (whether in- transit or originating), to enter any local port as of 12 a.m. on Feb. 4, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Total border crossing ban
target_country: China
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_what: Foreign Residents (Foreign Nationals Residing in the Country)

description: The government of Saint Lucia will not allow any non-national with a travel history within the last 14 days from Hong Kong, Republic of Korea, Japan, Italy, and Singapore, (whether in- transit or originating), to enter any local port as of 12 a.m. on Feb. 26, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description: The government of Saint Lucia will not allow any non-national with a travel history within the last 14 days from Spain, Mainland France, Germany, Iran, and the United Kingdom, (whether in- transit or originating), to enter any local port as of Mar. 17, 2020.

description: Saint Lucians are encouraged to prepare households in the event of a possible outbreak of COVID-19 in the community. (on March 23)
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
target_country: Saint Lucia

description: Mandatory quarantine for travelers from China. Any national returning to Saint Lucia from China with similar travel history, will be quarantined for 14 days. Quarantine centers have been set up using various hotels to facilitate the large numbers of returning nationals and any non-nationals that may arrive of concern. All persons in quarantine are provided with breakfast, lunch and dinner.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Quarantine outside the home or government facility (i.e. quarantine in a hotel)
target_country: China
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Mandatory quarantine for nationals returning from Spain, Mainland France, Germany, Iran and the United Kingdom, Mainland China, Hong Kong, the Republic of Korea, Japan, Italy, and Singapore will be quarantined for 14 days. Quarantine centers have been set up using various hotels to facilitate the large numbers of returning nationals and any non-nationals that may arrive of concern. description: Mandatory quarantine for nationals returning from Spain, Mainland France, Germany, Iran and the United Kingdom, Mainland China, Hong Kong, the Republic of Korea, Japan, Italy, and Singapore will be quarantined for 14 days. Quarantine centers have been set up using various hotels to facilitate the large numbers of returning nationals and any non-nationals that may arrive of concern. All persons in quarantine are provided with breakfast, lunch and dinner. UPDATE: Home quarantine in situations where individuals have health complications, small children, are unable to function independently, and other sensitive situations. Inspection of homes by health officials prior to approval are. necessary.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Quarantine outside the home or government facility (i.e. quarantine in a hotel)

target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective October 15, 2020, those who have received a negative PCR result and meet the criteria to thereafter be quarantined at home as determined by the Health Authorities, would be granted permission to do so. 14-day Home Quarantine will apply strictly to minors, persons with health conditions and those with specific conditions. These individuals will also be required to wear the electronic monitoring devices at the abovementioned cost.

description: Visitors who, immediately before arriving in St. Lucia, were in a Bubble Country for at least 21 days are considered Bubble Travelers and will be exempt from quarantine; however, they must have a negative result from a PCR test taken no more than 7 days before arriving in Saint Lucia, and are subject to mandatory screening on arrival.

description: As of Jan. 21, 2021, marine Arrivals: For travelers from outside the CARICOM Travel Bubble, if fewer than 14 days are spent at sea, the remainder of the 14-day quarantine period must be observed at anchor, at a designated quarantine dock, or in a COVID-19 certified property in accordance with marine protocols. Persons on vessels arriving at night must remain on board until the following morning when they will be checked by Port Health authorities.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
